qas.question: Where did best selling author Stephenie Meyer graduate from in 1995?
Which former Miss America graduated from BYU?
Which former co-host of CBS's The Early Show graduated from BYU?
Which award winning ESPN sports writer graduated form BYU?
Which former CBS News correspondent graduated from BYU?
What best selling author graduated from BYU in 1957?
What best selling author graduated from BYU in 1989?
What best selling author graduated from BYU in 1959?
When did Miss America Sharlene Johnson graduate?
What is Ken Dutcher considered to be?

context: In literature and journalism, <a0_0>BYU<a0_0/> has produced several best-selling authors, including <b5_0>Orson Scott Card<b5_0/> '75, Brandon Sanderson '00 & '05, <b6_0>Ben English<b6_0/> '98, and <b7_0>Stephenie Meyer<b7_0/> '95. BYU also graduated American activist and contributor for ABC News Elizabeth Smart-Gilmour. Other media personalities include former CBS News correspondent <a4_0>Art Rascon<a4_0/>, award-winning ESPN sportscaster and former Miss America <a1_0><a3_0>Sharlene Wells Hawkes<a3_0/><a1_0/> <b8_0>'86<b8_0/> and former co-host of CBS's The Early Show <a2_0>Jane Clayson Johnson<a2_0/> '90. In entertainment and television, BYU is represented by Jon Heder '02 (best known for his role as Napoleon Dynamite), writer-director Daryn Tufts '98, Golden Globe-nominated Aaron Eckhart '94, animator and filmmaker Don Bluth '54, Jeopardy! all-time champion Ken Jennings '00, and Richard Dutcher, the "<b9_0>Father of Mormon Cinema.<b9_0/>" In the music industry BYU is represented by lead singer of the Grammy Award winning band Imagine Dragons Dan Reynolds, multi-platinum selling drummer Elaine Bradley from the band Neon Trees, crossover dubstep violinist Lindsey Stirling, former American Idol contestant Carmen Rasmusen, Mormon Tabernacle Choir director Mack Wilberg and pianist Massimiliano Frani.
